title: Police investigate shooting of toddler on Savannah's westside
content:
Police say a toddler was grazed by a bullet after a gun was discharged inside an apartment on Savannah’s west side Thursday night.
Officers were called to 401 Carolan St., near West Bay Street, about 7:10 p.m. Inside one of the apartments at that location, first responders found a 2-year-old boy who had been grazed by a bullet, said Michelle Gavin, Savannah-Chatham police spokeswoman.
He was taken to a hospital with injuries not believed to be life threatening.
Detectives were at the hospital with the child and his mother about 8:30 p.m., Gavin said, and others were interviewing people inside the apartment.
The investigation was in its early stages, and no further information was immediately available.
